Martin,
I think the error is due to the fact that FLUENT can find one of the
functions
which was used in your udf library or in one of the functions called by
the udf library.
Here are a few suggestions:

Put extern "C" in front of the C++ functions that you want to use in C
? 

If you are directly using Cantera C++ functions from your UDF sources
you might need build
C-friendly wrappers for the C++ code which have the ' extern "C" ' in
the declaration.

Try using the command nm --demangle on the udf library file
"$FLUENT_ARCH/$SOLVER/libudf.so",
this will show which functions are undefined.

In the makefile add the Cantera libraries to the list of libraries for
the link step.  You might also need to
include the path "-L" to the Cantera directory.

Dave H.

>>> m.olausson@... 9/27/2004 10:55:11 AM >>>
Hi,

I'm trying to link cantera to fluent as in the example available in 
the Files-menu, but fluent can't open the library. The error-message 
in fluent is:

Opening library "libudf"...
Error: open_udf_library:  _ZN3tpx6GetSubEi
Error Object: #f

I'm trying to do this on a linux-RedHat8.0-gcc/g++3.2-7 with fluent 
6.1.18, following the instructions in the README-file. The compiling 
part is ok (no errors). I also tried to set up my own case from 
scratch and follow the instructions in this thread, but I got the 
same error.

If anyone knows what I'm doing wrong or where the error might be, 
please respond. If anyone have other examples available, I would 
appreciate very much if I could have them.

Thank you!
Martin Olausson
